articles.content:
This week, we'll be bringing together the pieces of the TUIse sessions we had during the season.
For this, we'll be going through the time-line in reverse order.

The ultimate goal is to have a working TUIse prototype assembled and working by **June 30th 2017**.
In order to leave nobody behind, we have written this step-by-step guide:

* Lesson one:   [How to clean install my RPi.](http://tuihackfridays.com/#article/12)
* Lesson two:   How to install all dependencies on my RPi.
* Lesson three: Installing the web interface, server style.
* Lesson four:   Implementing the TUIse components.
* Lesson five:    Add the hardware and bring TUIse alive.
* Lesson six:     Dress her up - casing example _(send in your proposal before the 16th)_

.
_Disclaimer: we are writing down the lessons as we speak, bear with us_

.


.

![RPi](https://www.raspberrypi.org/app/uploads/2015/08/raspberry-pi-logo.png)

articles.title: Tuise Lesson one - How to clean install my RPi
articles.intro: So you took your RPi home and embarked an heroic attempt to automate the grain flow on your chicken'
articles.content:
So you took your RPi home and embarked an heroic attempt to automate the grain flow on your chicken's den? We've all been there.
Accidently cluttered the RPi with complete nonsense you're ashamed of now? We've got t-shirts.

There's always a **clean install** to the rescue.

### Step 1.
Buy a 8GB, 16GB or higher micro SD card and SD card shield. 
Like this one: [https://www.gotron.be/huis-tuin/computer-toebehoren/geheugen/transcend-micro-sdhc-geheugenkaart-16gb-klasse-10.html](https://www.gotron.be/huis-tuin/computer-toebehoren/geheugen/transcend-micro-sdhc-geheugenkaart-16gb-klasse-10.html) 


### Step 2.
Assuming you have a computer with a SD card reader, we'll now flash the SD.

##### Raspbian
Download the +- 1,5GB Raspbian Jessie image.
There you go: [https://www.raspberrypi.org/downloads/raspbian/](https://www.raspberrypi.org/downloads/raspbian/) - you'll want the Pixel flavour.

##### Etcher
By far the easiest way to Flash that disk is called Esher.
Download it here: [https://etcher.io/](https://etcher.io/)

Once Etcher is installed, you'll be able to select both the zip (you can leave it compressed) and the destination SD. 
Depending on your SD spec & brand, the flash process takes about 6 minutes.

![Etcher](https://etcher.io/static/screenshot-1x.gif)


### Step 3.
Time to boot and update.
Insert your Micro SD in the RPi (teeth up). Connect power & be proud of what you just realised.
It's a common practice to update before we finish off.

Open your CLI terminal and run the follwing 2 commands:

```sudo apt-get update```

```sudo apt-get dist-upgrade```

There you go.
